questions.paragraph: Compare between: Conductive materials and insulating materials of electricity
popup: Conductive materials for electricity: Materials that allow the electric current to flow through them easily, such as iron.
Insulating materials for electricity: Materials that do not allow the electric current to flow through them easily, such as wood.
Magnetic materials: Materials that are attracted to magnets, such as nickel.
Non-magnetic materials: Materials that are not attracted to magnets, such as rubber.

questions.paragraph: What happens when touching an uninsulated wire carrying an electric current?
popup: The current flows through the body, causing an electric shock.

questions.paragraph: A glass cup broke, and Mary suggested collecting its scattered remnants on the ground using a magnet. Do you agree with Mary's opinion? Please explain your reasoning.
popup: No, because glass is a non-magnetic material that is not attracted to magnets.

questions.paragraph: Electric wires are made of copper or aluminum. Explain the reason.
popup: Because they are conductive materials that allow the electric current to flow through them.

questions.paragraph: What happens if a wire carrying an electric current is wound around an iron nail?
popup: The magnetic field produced by the electric current becomes stronger.

quizChooses.title: Answer the following
quizChooses.qtitle: Write the function of each of the following

popup: Covering electric wires and hands of electric tools.

quizChooses.title: Answer the following
quizChooses.qtitle: Give reason for each of the following

questions.paragraph: The electric current flowing in the electric circuit increases after removing the electric resistance.
popup: Because electric resistor slows down the flow of electric current in the electric circuit.
The stability of objects and human on the Earth's surface.
